oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Twisted impregnated yarns: elastic properties
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: NAIK, NK
MADHAVAN, V
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: twisted impregnated yarn
elastic properties
varying twist
migration
microbuckling
impregnated straight strand
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Twisted yarns are normally used for increasing the lateral cohesion of filaments and also for ease of handling. By twisting yarns, the microdamage can be localized, leading to possible increase in the failure strength of the yarns. In this paper, an analytical method is presented for predicting the elastic properties of twisted impregnated yarns made of long unbroken filaments. In the analysis, various degrees of twist in filaments at different radii of the yarn and possible migration and microbuckling are considered. The effects of the twist angle and the extent of migration and microbuckling on the elastic properties and the pre-straining of the yarn are presented.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: JOURNAL OF STRAIN ANALYSIS FOR ENGINEERING DESIGN, 35(2), 83-91
